intro: Visiania phyllothyrsa, commonly known as the broadleaf poinsettia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its large, showy bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with thick, fleshy stems and alternate, ovate leaves. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, clustered in dense inflorescences at the ends of the branches. Visiania phyllothyrsa is often cultivated for its ornamental value, particularly during the holiday season.
